segment.source: Add Multilingual Support to Windows Setup
segment.target: Add Multilingual Support to Windows Setup

segment.source: Add Multilingual Support to Windows Setup
segment.target: Add Multilingual Support to Windows Setup

segment.source: This walkthrough provides steps for creating multilingual installations and distributable media.
segment.target: This walkthrough provides steps for creating multilingual installations and distributable media.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Copy Windows Source Files to a Local Directory
segment.target: Copy Windows Source Files to a Local Directory

segment.source: Add Windows PE Setup Language Packs to the Default Boot Image
segment.target: Add Windows PE Setup Language Packs to the Default Boot Image

segment.source: Add Font Support to the Default Boot Image
segment.target: Add Font Support to the Default Boot Image

segment.source: Add Windows Language Packs to the Windows Image
segment.target: Add Windows Language Packs to the Windows Image

segment.source: Step 5: Add Localized Windows Setup Resources to the Windows Distribution
segment.target: Step 5: Add Localized Windows Setup Resources to the Windows Distribution

segment.source: Step 6: Recreate the Lang.ini
segment.target: Step 6: Recreate the Lang.ini

segment.source: Step 7: Commit the changes to the Windows images
segment.target: Step 7: Commit the changes to the Windows images

segment.source: Step 8: Create a Boot Order File (Optional)
segment.target: Step 8: Create a Boot Order File (Optional)

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: To complete this walkthrough, you need the following:
segment.target: To complete this walkthrough, you need the following:

segment.source: A technician computer that has the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) installed.
segment.target: A technician computer that has the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) installed.

segment.source: Windows product DVD.
segment.target: Windows product DVD.

segment.source: Step 1: Copy Windows Distribution Files to a Local Directory
segment.target: Step 1: Copy Windows Distribution Files to a Local Directory

segment.source: In this step, you copy the contents of your Windows product media to a local hard drive.
segment.target: In this step, you copy the contents of your Windows product media to a local hard drive.

segment.source: You must use the Windows media that corresponds to the version of the customized image that you are building.
segment.target: You must use the Windows media that corresponds to the version of the customized image that you are building.

segment.source: For example, if you are building a custom Windows 8 setup image, you must use the original Windows 8 product media.
segment.target: For example, if you are building a custom Windows 8 setup image, you must use the original Windows 8 product media.

segment.source: On your technician computer, create a new directory for your Windows distribution and copy the Windows media content to that directory.
segment.target: On your technician computer, create a new directory for your Windows distribution and copy the Windows media content to that directory.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Where D: is the location of the Windows product media.
segment.target: Where D: is the location of the Windows product media.

segment.source: Step 2: Add Windows PE Setup Language Packs to the Default Boot Image
segment.target: Step 2: Add Windows PE Setup Language Packs to the Default Boot Image

segment.source: In this step, you add language support and the Windows Setup optional components to the second image (index 2) in the default Boot.wim.
segment.target: In this step, you add language support and the Windows Setup optional components to the second image (index 2) in the default Boot.wim.

segment.source: On your technician computer: Click Start, and type deployment.
segment.target: On your technician computer: Click Start, and type deployment.

segment.source: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.

segment.source: Mount the second image (index 2) in Boot.wim to a local mount directory using the Dism /Mount-Image command.
segment.target: Mount the second image (index 2) in Boot.wim to a local mount directory using the Dism /Mount-Image command.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Add Windows PE Setup optional component and language packs into your mounted image using the Dism /Add-Package command for each language you want to support.
segment.target: Add Windows PE Setup optional component and language packs into your mounted image using the Dism /Add-Package command for each language you want to support.

segment.source: Windows PE language packs are available in the Windows ADK.
segment.target: Windows PE language packs are available in the Windows ADK.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: For Windows Server® 2012, you must use the WinPE-Setup-Server optional component and associated language pack.
segment.target: For Windows Server® 2012, you must use the WinPE-Setup-Server optional component and associated language pack.

segment.source: For Japanese (ja-JP), Korean (ko-KR), and Chinese (zh-HK, zh-CN, zh-TW), you must add additional font support to your image.
segment.target: For Japanese (ja-JP), Korean (ko-KR), and Chinese (zh-HK, zh-CN, zh-TW), you must add additional font support to your image.

segment.source: For example, to add Japanese font support, enter the following command.
segment.target: For example, to add Japanese font support, enter the following command.

segment.source: Recreate the Lang.ini file to reflect the additional language support using the Dism /Gen-LangINI command.
segment.target: Recreate the Lang.ini file to reflect the additional language support using the Dism /Gen-LangINI command.

segment.source: Change the Windows Setup default language by using DISM.
segment.target: Change the Windows Setup default language by using DISM.

segment.source: For example,
segment.target: For example,

segment.source: For more information about specifying different international settings for input locale, and other items see DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information about specifying different international settings for input locale, and other items see DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Save your changes back into the image using the Dism /Unmount–Image /Commit command.
segment.target: Save your changes back into the image using the Dism /Unmount–Image /Commit command.

segment.source: Step 3: Add Font Support to the Default Boot Image
segment.target: Step 3: Add Font Support to the Default Boot Image

segment.source: If you added font support for Japanese (ja-JP), Korean (ko-KR), or Chinese (zh-HK, zh-CN, zh-TW) to the default boot.wim image, you must also add font support to the first image (index 1) in the Boot.wim file.
segment.target: If you added font support for Japanese (ja-JP), Korean (ko-KR), or Chinese (zh-HK, zh-CN, zh-TW) to the default boot.wim image, you must also add font support to the first image (index 1) in the Boot.wim file.

segment.source: On your technician computer: Click Start, and type deployment.
segment.target: On your technician computer: Click Start, and type deployment.

segment.source: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.

segment.source: Use the Dism /Mount-Image command to mount the first image (index 1) in the Boot.wim file to a local mount directory.
segment.target: Use the Dism /Mount-Image command to mount the first image (index 1) in the Boot.wim file to a local mount directory.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Add the same font support you added to the boot.wim default boot image in the previous step.
segment.target: Add the same font support you added to the boot.wim default boot image in the previous step.

segment.source: For example, to add Japanese font support, enter the following command.
segment.target: For example, to add Japanese font support, enter the following command.

segment.source: Save your changes back into the image using the Dism /Unmount-Image /Commit command.
segment.target: Save your changes back into the image using the Dism /Unmount-Image /Commit command.

segment.source: Step 4: Add Language Packs to the Windows Image
segment.target: Step 4: Add Language Packs to the Windows Image

segment.source: You must add the same language support to your Windows image file, Install.wim, as you did for the Boot.wim file.
segment.target: You must add the same language support to your Windows image file, Install.wim, as you did for the Boot.wim file.

segment.source: The setup process requires that both images contain the same set of language packs.
segment.target: The setup process requires that both images contain the same set of language packs.

segment.source: For more information, see Add and Remove Language Packs Offline Using DISM.
segment.target: For more information, see Add and Remove Language Packs Offline Using DISM.

segment.source: Mount the Windows image by using DISM
segment.target: Mount the Windows image by using DISM

segment.source: Where 1 is the index of the image that you want to mount.
segment.target: Where 1 is the index of the image that you want to mount.

segment.source: Add one or more language packs to the Windows image.
segment.target: Add one or more language packs to the Windows image.

segment.source: The same set of languages must also be added to the Windows Recovery Environment image (winre.wim).
segment.target: The same set of languages must also be added to the Windows Recovery Environment image (winre.wim).

segment.source: For more information, see Customize Windows RE.
segment.target: For more information, see Customize Windows RE.

segment.source: Step 5: Add Localized Windows Setup Resources to the Windows Distribution
segment.target: Step 5: Add Localized Windows Setup Resources to the Windows Distribution

segment.source: In this step you copy the language-specific Setup resources from each language specific Windows distribution to the Sources folder in your Windows distribution.
segment.target: In this step you copy the language-specific Setup resources from each language specific Windows distribution to the Sources folder in your Windows distribution.

segment.source: For example, insert the Windows DVD for Fr-FR in your DVD drive (E:) and copy the Fr-FR sources folder to your Windows distribution.
segment.target: For example, insert the Windows DVD for Fr-FR in your DVD drive (E:) and copy the Fr-FR sources folder to your Windows distribution.

segment.source: Copy the localized Windows setup files to your Windows distribution.
segment.target: Copy the localized Windows setup files to your Windows distribution.

segment.source: Where E: is the location of the Windows distribution that contains the localized Windows Setup resources.
segment.target: Where E: is the location of the Windows distribution that contains the localized Windows Setup resources.

segment.source: Step 6: Recreate the Lang.ini
segment.target: Step 6: Recreate the Lang.ini

segment.source: In this step you recreate the Lang.ini file and specify the default language settings.
segment.target: In this step you recreate the Lang.ini file and specify the default language settings.

segment.source: Recreate the Lang.ini file to reflect the additional language using the Dism /Gen-LangINI command.
segment.target: Recreate the Lang.ini file to reflect the additional language using the Dism /Gen-LangINI command.

segment.source: Change the Windows Setup default language by using DISM.
segment.target: Change the Windows Setup default language by using DISM.

segment.source: For example,
segment.target: For example,

segment.source: For more information about specifying different international settings for input locale, and other items see DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information about specifying different international settings for input locale, and other items see DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Copy the lang.ini file in the Windows distribution to the boot.wim file.
segment.target: Copy the lang.ini file in the Windows distribution to the boot.wim file.

segment.source: Step 7: Commit the Changes to the Windows Images
segment.target: Step 7: Commit the Changes to the Windows Images

segment.source: In this step you commit the changes to all of the Windows images you have updated
segment.target: In this step you commit the changes to all of the Windows images you have updated

segment.source: Use DISM to unmount and commit the changes to the Windows images.
segment.target: Use DISM to unmount and commit the changes to the Windows images.

segment.source: Step 8: Create a Boot Order File (Optional)
segment.target: Step 8: Create a Boot Order File (Optional)

segment.source: In this step, you create a boot order file.
segment.target: In this step, you create a boot order file.

segment.source: Due to the size of the image, you must do so before you create an .iso file.
segment.target: Due to the size of the image, you must do so before you create an .iso file.

segment.source: Create a boot order file (Bootorder.txt).
segment.target: Create a boot order file (Bootorder.txt).

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: where Bootorder.txt contains the following list of files:
segment.target: where Bootorder.txt contains the following list of files:

segment.source: Next Steps
segment.target: Next Steps

segment.source: You can now use the multilingual image to create media for distribution.
segment.target: You can now use the multilingual image to create media for distribution.

segment.source: To create bootable media such as a USB flash drive, see WinPE: Create USB Bootable drive.
segment.target: To create bootable media such as a USB flash drive, see WinPE: Create USB Bootable drive.

segment.source: You can also create a bootable CD or DVD.
segment.target: You can also create a bootable CD or DVD.

segment.source: However, due to the size of a multilingual image, you must first create a boot order file before you create a bootable image (.iso) file on CD or DVD.
segment.target: However, due to the size of a multilingual image, you must first create a boot order file before you create a bootable image (.iso) file on CD or DVD.

segment.source: For more information, see Oscdimg Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see Oscdimg Command-Line Options.
